post.author: 김민
post.content:
JDJ Readers' Choice Awards As Announced at Web Services Edge 2002 West Conference & Expo - San Jose, CA Oct. 1-3
2002 WINNERS AND FINALISTS
Best Java Book ---------------- Winner: O'Reilly & Associates (Java Message Service, by Richard Monson-Haefel and David A. Chappell)
1st Runner-Up: Prentice-Hall (J2EE Applications and BEA WebLogic Server by Michael Girdley, Rob Woollen, and Sandra L. Emerson)
2nd Runner-Up: Prentice-Hall (Core J2EE Patterns Best Practices and Design Strategies by Deepak Alur, Dan Malks, and John Crupi)
3rd Runner-Up: O'Reilly & Associates (Java in a Nutshell, by David Flanagan)
Best Database Tool or Driver ----------------------------- Winner: Oracle9i Business Components for Java (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: XML Spy Suite 4.2 (Altova) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9iAS TopLink (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: MM.MySQL JDBC Driver (MySQL AB)
Best Enterprise Database -------------------------- Winner: Oracle9i Database (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: IBM DB2 Universal Database v7.2 (IBM) 2nd Runner-Up: Borland JDataStore (Borland) 3rd Runner-Up: MySQL (MySQL AB)
Best J2EE IDE ----------------- Winner: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Developer 4.0 (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Forte for Java/NetBeans (Sun Microsystems) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle 9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland)
Best J2ME IDE ----------------- Winner: IBM VisualAge Micro Edition (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder MobileSet (Borland) 3rd Runner-Up: CodeWarrior for Java (Metroworks)
Best J2SE IDE ----------------- Winner: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland) 2nd Runner-Up: Forte for Java/NetBeans (Sun Microsystems) 3rd Runner-Up: IntelliJ IDEA (JetBrains, Inc.)
Best Java Application ---------------------- Winner: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland) 2nd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic Server 7.0 (BEA Systems) 3rd Runner-Up: IntelliJ IDEA (JetBrains, Inc.)
Best Java Application Server ------------------------------ Winner: BEA WebLogic Server 7.0 (BEA Systems)
1st Runner-Up: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Server 4.0 (IBM) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle 9i Application Server (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: JBoss (jboss.org)
Best Java Class Library ----------------------- Winner: The Java Collections Framework (Sun Microsystems)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper - BC4J BI Beans (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Host Access Class Library (IBM) 3rd Runner-Up: Eclipse (Eclipse Technology)
Best Java Component -------------- Winner: ILOG JTGO (ILOG)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle Business Components for Java (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic Portal (BEA Systems) 3rd Runner-Up: Sitraka JClass (Sitraka)
Best Java Data Access Tool Winner: Oracle Business Components for Java (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: XML Spy Suite 4.2 (Altova) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9iAS TopLink (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: CA Advantage EDBC for Java Data Access (Computer Associates)
Best Java Developer Studio Winner: Together ControlCenter 5.5 (TogetherSoft)
1st Runner-Up: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Developer 4.0 (IBM) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland Enterprise Studio for Java (Borland)
Best Java EAI Platform Winner: IBM WebSphere MQ (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i Application Server (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic Integration (BEA Systems) 3rd Runner-Up: SonicXQ 1.0 (Sonic Software)
Best Java e-Business Framework Winner: IBM WebSphere (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper with Business Components for Java (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic Server 7.0 (BEA Systems) 3rd Runner-Up Borland JBuilder (Borland)
Best Java IDE Environment Winner: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Developer 4.0 (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: NetBeans (NetBeans.org) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up Borland JBuilder (Borland)
Best Java Installation Tool Winner: InstallAnywhere (Zero G)
1st Runner-Up: InstallShield MultiPlatform (InstallShield) 2nd Runner-Up: Java Message Queue (Sun Microsystems) 3rd Runner-Up: Sitraka DeployDirector (Sitraka)
Best Java Messaging Tool Winner: IBM WebSphere MQ (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i Application Server (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: SonicMQ 4.0 (Sonic Software) 3rd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic Server 7.0 (BEA Systems)
Best Java Modeling Tool Winner: MagicDraw UML 5.0 (No Magic, Inc.)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Rational Rose Professional J Edition (Rational) 3rd Runner-Up: Together ControlCenter 5.5 (TogetherSoft)
Best Java Profiling Tool Winner: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: Metameta Debug Enterprise (Metameta) 2nd Runner-Up: IBM VisualAge Micro Edition - MicroAnalyzer (IBM) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland Optimizeit Suite 4.11 (Borland)
Best Java Reporting Tool Winner: StyleReportEE (InetSoft Technology Corp)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9iAS Reports/Discoverer (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Together ControlCenter 5.5 (TogetherSoft) 3rd Runner-Up: JReport (Jinfonet Software)
Best Java Testing Tool Winner: Borland Optimizeit Suite 4.11 (Borland Software Corp)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: JUnit (Object Mentor, Inc.) 3rd Runner-Up: Rational Suite TestStudio (Rational Software Corp)
Best Wireless Java Application Winner: IBM WebSphere Transcoding Publisher (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i Application Server (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: iAnywhere m-Business Studio (iAnywhere Solutions, a Sybase company) 3rd Runner-Up: COOL:Plex/Websydian (Computer Associates)
Best XML Tool Winner: XML Spy Suite 4.2 (Altova)
1st Runner-Up: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Developer 4.0 (IBM) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9i XDK (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland)
Most Innovative Java Product Winner: Together ControlCenter 5.5 (TogetherSoft)
1st Runner-Up: IBM WebSphere Studio Application Developer 4.0 (IBM) 2nd Runner-Up: Oracle9i Application Server with Advanced Clustering (Oracle) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland)
Best Java Virtual Machine Winner: Oracle9i JVM (Oracle)
1st Runner-Up: The J9 Virtual Machine (IBM/Object Technology International) 2nd Runner-Up: Java HotSpot Performance Engine (Sun Microsystems) 3rd Runner-Up: BEA WebLogic JRockit Server Side VM (BEA Systems)
Best Team Development Tool Winner: MagicDraw UML 5.0 Teamwork Server (No Magic Inc.)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i SCM (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Borland JBuilder (Borland) 3rd Runner-Up: Rational ClearCase (Rational)
Best Mobile Database Winner: PointBase Micro 4.1 (PointBase)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i Lite (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Cloudscape (IBM) 3rd Runner-Up: Borland JDataStore (Borland)
Best Java Web Services Development Toolkit Winner: IBM Web Services Toolkit (IBM)
1st Runner-Up: Oracle9i JDeveloper (Oracle) 2nd Runner-Up: Borland Web Services Kit for Java (Borland) 3rd Runner-Up: SonicXQ 1.0 (Sonic Software)
Best Java Training Program Winner: Java Productivity with JBuilder (Borland)
1st Runner-Up: Java BluePrints for Wireless Program (Sun Microsystems) 2nd Runner-Up: JCertify 5.0 (EnterpriseDeveloper.com) 3rd Runner-Up: Struts Fast Track Public Training (baseBeans Engineering)
post.title: JDJ Readers' Choice Awards - JAVA
